sentences: Irving Berman, was a Newark, New Jersey businessman, record company owner, and nightclub impresario.
Berman founded the jazz imprint Regis Records (1943–1946), and then the more successful Manor Records (1945–1949).
In 1949 The Four Tunes left Manor and signed with RCA causing Berman to sue for breach of contract.
He then turned up as A&R director for the newly-formed Arco Records (1949 onwards).
